intro: Centaurium calycosum var. arizonicum, commonly known as Arizona starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. The species is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
